trans-unit.source: This article explains how to load and save image files using BitmapDecoder and BitmapEncoder and how to use the SoftwareBitmap object to represent bitmap images.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to load and save image files using BitmapDecoder and BitmapEncoder and how to use the SoftwareBitmap object to represent bitmap images.

trans-unit.source: Imaging
trans-unit.target: Imaging

trans-unit.source: Imaging
trans-unit.target: Imaging

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to load and save image files using [**BitmapDecoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226176) and [**BitmapEncoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226206) and how to use the [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) object to represent bitmap images.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to load and save image files using [**BitmapDecoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226176) and [**BitmapEncoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226206) and how to use the [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) object to represent bitmap images.

trans-unit.source: The **SoftwareBitmap** class is a versatile API that can be created from multiple sources including image files, [**WriteableBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243259) objects, Direct3D surfaces, and code.
trans-unit.target: The **SoftwareBitmap** class is a versatile API that can be created from multiple sources including image files, [**WriteableBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243259) objects, Direct3D surfaces, and code.

trans-unit.source: **SoftwareBitmap** allows you to easily convert between different pixel formats and alpha modes, and allows low-level access to pixel data.
trans-unit.target: **SoftwareBitmap** allows you to easily convert between different pixel formats and alpha modes, and allows low-level access to pixel data.

trans-unit.source: Also, **SoftwareBitmap** is a common interface used by multiple features of Windows, including:
trans-unit.target: Also, **SoftwareBitmap** is a common interface used by multiple features of Windows, including:

trans-unit.source: [**CapturedFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278725) allows you to get frames captured by the camera as a **SoftwareBitmap**.
trans-unit.target: [**CapturedFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278725) allows you to get frames captured by the camera as a **SoftwareBitmap**.

trans-unit.source: [**VideoFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930917) allows you to get a **SoftwareBitmap** representation of a **VideoFrame**.
trans-unit.target: [**VideoFrame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn930917) allows you to get a **SoftwareBitmap** representation of a **VideoFrame**.

trans-unit.source: [**FaceDetector**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974129) allows you to detect faces in a **SoftwareBitmap**.
trans-unit.target: [**FaceDetector**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974129) allows you to detect faces in a **SoftwareBitmap**.

trans-unit.source: The sample code in this article uses APIs from the following namespaces.
trans-unit.target: The sample code in this article uses APIs from the following namespaces.

trans-unit.source: Namespaces
trans-unit.target: Namespaces

trans-unit.source: Create a SoftwareBitmap from an image file with BitmapDecoder
trans-unit.target: Create a SoftwareBitmap from an image file with BitmapDecoder

trans-unit.source: To create a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) from a file, get an instance of [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) containing the image data.
trans-unit.target: To create a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) from a file, get an instance of [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) containing the image data.

trans-unit.source: This example uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to allow the user to select an image file.
trans-unit.target: This example uses a [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to allow the user to select an image file.

trans-unit.source: PickInputFile
trans-unit.target: PickInputFile

trans-unit.source: Call the [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227116) method of the **StorageFile** object to get a random access stream containing the image data.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227116) method of the **StorageFile** object to get a random access stream containing the image data.

trans-unit.source: Call the static method [**BitmapDecoder.CreateAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226182) to get an instance of the [**BitmapDecoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226176) class for the specified stream.
trans-unit.target: Call the static method [**BitmapDecoder.CreateAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226182) to get an instance of the [**BitmapDecoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226176) class for the specified stream.

trans-unit.source: Call [**GetSoftwareBitmapAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887332) to get a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) object containing the image.
trans-unit.target: Call [**GetSoftwareBitmapAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887332) to get a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) object containing the image.

trans-unit.source: CreateSoftwareBitmapFromFile
trans-unit.target: CreateSoftwareBitmapFromFile

trans-unit.source: Save a SoftwareBitmap to a file with BitmapEncoder
trans-unit.target: Save a SoftwareBitmap to a file with BitmapEncoder

trans-unit.source: To save a **SoftwareBitmap** to a file, get an instance of **StorageFile** to which the image will be saved.
trans-unit.target: To save a **SoftwareBitmap** to a file, get an instance of **StorageFile** to which the image will be saved.

trans-unit.source: This example uses a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to allow the user to select an output file.
trans-unit.target: This example uses a [**FileSavePicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207871) to allow the user to select an output file.

trans-unit.source: PickOuputFile
trans-unit.target: PickOuputFile

trans-unit.source: Call the [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227116) method of the **StorageFile** object to get a random access stream to which the image will be written.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227116) method of the **StorageFile** object to get a random access stream to which the image will be written.

trans-unit.source: Call the static method [**BitmapEncoder.CreateAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226211) to get an instance of the [**BitmapEncoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226206) class for the specified stream.
trans-unit.target: Call the static method [**BitmapEncoder.CreateAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226211) to get an instance of the [**BitmapEncoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226206) class for the specified stream.

trans-unit.source: The first parameter to **CreateAsync** is a GUID representing the codec that should be used to encode the image.
trans-unit.target: The first parameter to **CreateAsync** is a GUID representing the codec that should be used to encode the image.

trans-unit.source: **BitmapEncoder** class exposes a property containing the ID for each codec supported by the encoder, such as [**JpegEncoderId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226226).
trans-unit.target: **BitmapEncoder** class exposes a property containing the ID for each codec supported by the encoder, such as [**JpegEncoderId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226226).

trans-unit.source: Use the [**SetSoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887337) method to set the image that will be encoded.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**SetSoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887337) method to set the image that will be encoded.

trans-unit.source: You can set values of the [**BitmapTransform**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226254) property to apply basic transforms to the image while it is being encoded.
trans-unit.target: You can set values of the [**BitmapTransform**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226254) property to apply basic transforms to the image while it is being encoded.

trans-unit.source: The [**IsThumbnailGenerated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226225) property determines whether a thumbnail is generated by the encoder.
trans-unit.target: The [**IsThumbnailGenerated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226225) property determines whether a thumbnail is generated by the encoder.

trans-unit.source: Note that not all file formats support thumbnails, so if you use this feature, you should catch the unsupported operation error that will be thrown if thumbnails are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Note that not all file formats support thumbnails, so if you use this feature, you should catch the unsupported operation error that will be thrown if thumbnails are not supported.

trans-unit.source: Call [**FlushAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226216) to cause the encoder to write the image data to the specified file.
trans-unit.target: Call [**FlushAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226216) to cause the encoder to write the image data to the specified file.

trans-unit.source: SaveSoftwareBitmapToFile
trans-unit.target: SaveSoftwareBitmapToFile

trans-unit.source: You can specify additional encoding options when you create the **BitmapEncoder** by creating a new [**BitmapPropertySet**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh974338) object and populating it with one or more [**BitmapTypedValue**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700687) objects representing the encoder settings.
trans-unit.target: You can specify additional encoding options when you create the **BitmapEncoder** by creating a new [**BitmapPropertySet**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh974338) object and populating it with one or more [**BitmapTypedValue**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700687) objects representing the encoder settings.

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported encoder options, see [BitmapEncoder options reference](bitmapencoder-options-reference.md).
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported encoder options, see [BitmapEncoder options reference](bitmapencoder-options-reference.md).

trans-unit.source: UseEncodingOptions
trans-unit.target: UseEncodingOptions

trans-unit.source: Use SoftwareBitmap with a XAML Image control
trans-unit.target: Use SoftwareBitmap with a XAML Image control

trans-unit.source: To display an image within a XAML page using the [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242752) control, first define an **Image** control in your XAML page.
trans-unit.target: To display an image within a XAML page using the [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242752) control, first define an **Image** control in your XAML page.

trans-unit.source: ImageControl
trans-unit.target: ImageControl

trans-unit.source: Create a new [**SoftwareBitmapSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997854) object.
trans-unit.target: Create a new [**SoftwareBitmapSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997854) object.

trans-unit.source: Set the contents of the source object by calling [**SetBitmapAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997856), passing in a **SoftwareBitmap**.
trans-unit.target: Set the contents of the source object by calling [**SetBitmapAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn997856), passing in a **SoftwareBitmap**.

trans-unit.source: Then you can set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242760) property of the **Image** control to the newly created **SoftwareBitmapSource**.
trans-unit.target: Then you can set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242760) property of the **Image** control to the newly created **SoftwareBitmapSource**.

trans-unit.source: SoftwareBitmapToWriteableBitmap
trans-unit.target: SoftwareBitmapToWriteableBitmap

trans-unit.source: You can also use **SoftwareBitmapSource** to set a **SoftwareBitmap** as the [**ImageSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br210105) for an [**ImageBrush**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br210101).
trans-unit.target: You can also use **SoftwareBitmapSource** to set a **SoftwareBitmap** as the [**ImageSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br210105) for an [**ImageBrush**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br210101).

trans-unit.source: Create a SoftwareBitmap from a WriteableBitmap
trans-unit.target: Create a SoftwareBitmap from a WriteableBitmap

trans-unit.source: You can create a **SoftwareBitmap** from an existing **WriteableBitmap** by calling [**SoftwareBitmap.CreateCopyFromBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887370) and supplying the **PixelBuffer** property of the **WriteableBitmap** to set the pixel data.
trans-unit.target: You can create a **SoftwareBitmap** from an existing **WriteableBitmap** by calling [**SoftwareBitmap.CreateCopyFromBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887370) and supplying the **PixelBuffer** property of the **WriteableBitmap** to set the pixel data.

trans-unit.source: The second argument allows you to request a pixel format for the newly created **WriteableBitmap**.
trans-unit.target: The second argument allows you to request a pixel format for the newly created **WriteableBitmap**.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**PixelWidth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243253) and [**PixelHeight**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243251) properties of the **WriteableBitmap** to specify the dimensions of the new image.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**PixelWidth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243253) and [**PixelHeight**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243251) properties of the **WriteableBitmap** to specify the dimensions of the new image.

trans-unit.source: WriteableBitmapToSoftwareBitmap
trans-unit.target: WriteableBitmapToSoftwareBitmap

trans-unit.source: Create or edit a SoftwareBitmap programmatically
trans-unit.target: Create or edit a SoftwareBitmap programmatically

trans-unit.source: So far this topic has addressed working with image files.
trans-unit.target: So far this topic has addressed working with image files.

trans-unit.source: You can also create a new **SoftwareBitmap** programatically in code and use the same technique to access and modify the **SoftwareBitmap**'s pixel data.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a new **SoftwareBitmap** programatically in code and use the same technique to access and modify the **SoftwareBitmap**'s pixel data.

trans-unit.source: **SoftwareBitmap** uses COM interop to expose the raw buffer containing the pixel data.
trans-unit.target: **SoftwareBitmap** uses COM interop to expose the raw buffer containing the pixel data.

trans-unit.source: To use COM interop, you must include a reference to the **System.Runtime.InteropServices** namespace in your project.
trans-unit.target: To use COM interop, you must include a reference to the **System.Runtime.InteropServices** namespace in your project.

trans-unit.source: InteropNamespace
trans-unit.target: InteropNamespace

trans-unit.source: Initialize the [**IMemoryBufferByteAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/mt297505) COM interface by adding the following code within your namespace.
trans-unit.target: Initialize the [**IMemoryBufferByteAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/mt297505) COM interface by adding the following code within your namespace.

trans-unit.source: COMImport
trans-unit.target: COMImport

trans-unit.source: Create a new **SoftwareBitmap** with pixel format and size you want.
trans-unit.target: Create a new **SoftwareBitmap** with pixel format and size you want.

trans-unit.source: Or, use an existing **SoftwareBitmap** for which you want to edit the pixel data.
trans-unit.target: Or, use an existing **SoftwareBitmap** for which you want to edit the pixel data.

trans-unit.source: Call [**SoftwareBitmap.LockBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887380) to obtain an instance of the [**BitmapBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887325) class representing the pixel data buffer.
trans-unit.target: Call [**SoftwareBitmap.LockBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887380) to obtain an instance of the [**BitmapBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887325) class representing the pixel data buffer.

trans-unit.source: Cast the **BitmapBuffer** to the **IMemoryBufferByteAccess** COM interface and then call [**IMemoryBufferByteAccess.GetBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/mt297506) to populate a byte array with data.
trans-unit.target: Cast the **BitmapBuffer** to the **IMemoryBufferByteAccess** COM interface and then call [**IMemoryBufferByteAccess.GetBuffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/mt297506) to populate a byte array with data.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**BitmapBuffer.GetPlaneDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887330) method to get a [**BitmapPlaneDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887342) object that will help you calculate the offset into the buffer for each pixel.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**BitmapBuffer.GetPlaneDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887330) method to get a [**BitmapPlaneDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887342) object that will help you calculate the offset into the buffer for each pixel.

trans-unit.source: CreateNewSoftwareBitmap
trans-unit.target: CreateNewSoftwareBitmap

trans-unit.source: Because this method accesses the raw buffer underlying the Windows Runtime types, it must be declared using the **unsafe** keyword.
trans-unit.target: Because this method accesses the raw buffer underlying the Windows Runtime types, it must be declared using the **unsafe** keyword.

trans-unit.source: You must also configure your project in Microsoft Visual Studio to allow the compilation of unsafe code by opening the project's **Properties** page, clicking the **Build** property page, and selecting the **Allow Unsafe Code** checkbox.
trans-unit.target: You must also configure your project in Microsoft Visual Studio to allow the compilation of unsafe code by opening the project's **Properties** page, clicking the **Build** property page, and selecting the **Allow Unsafe Code** checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a SoftwareBitmap from a Direct3D surface
trans-unit.target: Create a SoftwareBitmap from a Direct3D surface

trans-unit.source: To create a **SoftwareBitmap** object from a Direct3D surface, you must include the [**Windows.Graphics.DirectX.Direct3D11**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn895104) namespace in your project.
trans-unit.target: To create a **SoftwareBitmap** object from a Direct3D surface, you must include the [**Windows.Graphics.DirectX.Direct3D11**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn895104) namespace in your project.

trans-unit.source: Direct3DNamespace
trans-unit.target: Direct3DNamespace

trans-unit.source: Call [**CreateCopyFromSurfaceAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887373) to create a new **SoftwareBitmap** from the surface.
trans-unit.target: Call [**CreateCopyFromSurfaceAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887373) to create a new **SoftwareBitmap** from the surface.

trans-unit.source: As the name indicates, the new **SoftwareBitmap** has a separate copy of the image data.
trans-unit.target: As the name indicates, the new **SoftwareBitmap** has a separate copy of the image data.

trans-unit.source: Modifications to the **SoftwareBitmap** will not have any effect on the Direct3D surface.
trans-unit.target: Modifications to the **SoftwareBitmap** will not have any effect on the Direct3D surface.

trans-unit.source: CreateSoftwareBitmapFromSurface
trans-unit.target: CreateSoftwareBitmapFromSurface

trans-unit.source: Convert a SoftwareBitmap to a different pixel format
trans-unit.target: Convert a SoftwareBitmap to a different pixel format

trans-unit.source: The **SoftwareBitmap** class provides the static method, [**Convert**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887362), that allows you to easily create a new **SoftwareBitmap** that uses the pixel format and alpha mode you specify from an existing **SoftwareBitmap**.
trans-unit.target: The **SoftwareBitmap** class provides the static method, [**Convert**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887362), that allows you to easily create a new **SoftwareBitmap** that uses the pixel format and alpha mode you specify from an existing **SoftwareBitmap**.

trans-unit.source: Note that the newly created bitmap has a separate copy of the image data.
trans-unit.target: Note that the newly created bitmap has a separate copy of the image data.

trans-unit.source: Modifications to the new bitmap will not affect the source bitmap.
trans-unit.target: Modifications to the new bitmap will not affect the source bitmap.

trans-unit.source: Convert
trans-unit.target: Convert

trans-unit.source: Transcode an image file
trans-unit.target: Transcode an image file

trans-unit.source: You can transcode an image file directly from a [**BitmapDecoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226176) to a [**BitmapEncoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226206).
trans-unit.target: You can transcode an image file directly from a [**BitmapDecoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226176) to a [**BitmapEncoder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226206).

trans-unit.source: Create a [**IRandomAccessStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241731) from the file to be transcoded.
trans-unit.target: Create a [**IRandomAccessStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241731) from the file to be transcoded.

trans-unit.source: Create a new **BitmapDecoder** from the input stream.
trans-unit.target: Create a new **BitmapDecoder** from the input stream.

trans-unit.source: Create a new [**InMemoryRandomAccessStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241720) for the encoder to write to and call [**BitmapEncoder.CreateForTranscodingAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226214), passing in the in-memory stream and the decoder object.
trans-unit.target: Create a new [**InMemoryRandomAccessStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241720) for the encoder to write to and call [**BitmapEncoder.CreateForTranscodingAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226214), passing in the in-memory stream and the decoder object.

trans-unit.source: Set the encoding properties you want.
trans-unit.target: Set the encoding properties you want.

trans-unit.source: Any properties in the input image file that you do not specifically set on the encoder, will be written to the output file unchanged.
trans-unit.target: Any properties in the input image file that you do not specifically set on the encoder, will be written to the output file unchanged.

trans-unit.source: Call [**FlushAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226216) to cause the encoder to encode to the in-memory stream.
trans-unit.target: Call [**FlushAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226216) to cause the encoder to encode to the in-memory stream.

trans-unit.source: Finally, seek the file stream and the in-memory stream to the beginning and call [**CopyAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701827) to write the in-memory stream out to the file stream.
trans-unit.target: Finally, seek the file stream and the in-memory stream to the beginning and call [**CopyAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701827) to write the in-memory stream out to the file stream.

trans-unit.source: TranscodeImageFile
trans-unit.target: TranscodeImageFile
